titlestmt.titleproper: Haim Gamzu Collection of Israeli Theater
titlestmt.author: by Susan Brady and Eve Neiger

publicationstmt.publisher: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Tuesday April 23, 2019 at 03:04

did.unittitle: Haim Gamzu Collection of Israeli Theater

repository.corpname: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

did.abstract: The Haim Gamzu Collection of Israeli Theater includes production programs, newspaper clippings and other printed material; production photographs; and posters. The material documents the development of theatrical production in Israel from the 1920s through the 1950s. Theaters represented include Habimah, Hamatateh, Ohel, Te'atron ha-Kameri shel Tel-Aviv, and others. Additional material includes photographs and printed material about Israeli actor Ari Kutai, and caricature drawings of prominent Israeli figures by Ze'ev.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Purchased from Kedem Auctions, Ltd. on the Edwin J. Beinecke Book Fund, 2010.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The Haim Gamzu Collection of Israeli Theater is the physical property of the Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University. Literary rights, including copyright, belong to the authors or their legal heirs and assigns. For further information, consult the appropriate curator.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Haim Gamzu Collection of Israeli Theater. General Collection, Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Haim Gamzu (1910-1982), was an Israeli art and drama critic. He was born in Chernigov, Russia, and went to Palestine with his parents in 1923. He studied art and philsophy at the Sorbonne and the University of Vienna. He became the director of the Tel Aviv Museum in 1962, and he established and taught at Israel's first theater school, Beit Zvi, in Ramat Gan. Gamzu authored several books on painting and sculpture, and his articles on painting, sculpture and theater were published in the daily Haaretz and elsewhere.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Haim Gamzu Collection of Israeli Theater includes production programs, newspaper clippings and other printed material; production photographs; and posters. The material documents the development of theatrical production in Israel from the 1920s through the 1950s. Theaters represented include Habimah, Hamatateh, Ohel, Te'atron ha-Kameri shel Tel-Aviv, and others. Additional material includes photographs and printed material about Israeli actor Ari Kutai, and caricatures of prominent Israeli figures by Ze'ev.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized into three series: I. Production programs and clippings, 1921-1957. II. Photographs, 1929-1958. III. Materials Relating to Ari Kutai, 1926-1955. IV. Posters and Caricatures, 1921-1954.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Collections are processed to a variety of levels, depending on the work necessary to make them usable, their perceived research value, the availability of staff, competing priorities, and whether or not further accruals are expected. The library attempts to provide a basic level of preservation and access for all collections, and does more extensive processing of higher priority collections as time and resources permit.
Within this collection some material in Hebrew that staff was unable to translate has been described as unidentified and/or undated.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Series I consists of production programs and clippings dating from 1921 to 1957 and undated, regarding productions in theaters including Habimah, HaOhel, HaTeatron HaEretz-Israeli and Te'atron HaKameri. Also included are programs for performances of individual artists Deborah Bertonoff, Martha Graham, Yehudi Menuhin, and others.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes Deborah Bertonoff, Martha Graham, and Yehudi Menuhin

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Arranged alphabetically by theater, then by title of production.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Series II includes production photographs from theaters including Habimah ( The Dybbuk , The Glass Menagerie , Othello and others); HaMatateh ( From India to Ethiopia , The King of Lampedusa and others); HaOhel ( Bar Kochbah , For Whom the Bell Tolls , The Merry Wives of Windsor , and others); and Te'Atron ha-Kameri shel Tel-Aviv ( Anne Frank , As You Like It , The Miser , and others).

unittitle.title: In the Wastes of the Negev
A Tale of Three and Four
The Teahouse of the August Moon
The Travels of Benjamin the Third

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Photograph of cast members with author Georges Duhamel.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Series III includes photographs, illustrations, and newspaper clippings relating to the actor Ari Kutai.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Series IV includes two posters from HaTeatron Haivri and HaTeatron HaEretz-Israeli, both from 1921, and caricatures by Ze'ev of actors including Yitzhak Shiloh and other public figures.

did.unittitle: Posters from HaTeatron Haivri and HaTeatron HaEretz-Israeli
Caricatures of actors and other public figures by Ze'ev
